page.title: 20A Walk In Swineshead
page.content: Enter the village from the east which is one of the most attractive approaches, the church spire is seen behind the brown colour washed cottages and the frontages of Three Horseshoe Cottage and School House catch the eye. Walking through the village one cannot fail to notice that the village is full of character and interesting buildings most of which are on the conservation list. The church is an impressive designed building in Early English style of 12th Century. One gets to feel the character and warmth of Swineshead. The contrast between the huddled buildings and the more spacious ones, the consistent building materials, the presence of some of the boundary walls and the continuation of hedgerows and trees add to the pleasure of the walk.
